newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia union takes legal action against govt.
newsitem.headline: Australia union takes legal action against govt.

text.p: The Community and Public Sector Union (CPSU) said on Thursday it had launched legal action against the federal government claiming it was acting in a way that discriminated against its members in the public service.
The union said the action was a response to the government's requirement that individual unionists confirm the deduction of union dues from their pay.
"The union claims that the singling out of union deductions is discriminatory and breaches international conventions to which Australia is party," the CPSU said in a statement.
The union said that since the government's announcement of payroll deductions, thousands of union members had moved to direct payment methods to maintain their privacy.
"We have been advised by our lawyers that we have a strong legal case," CPSU national secretary Wendy Caird told Reuters.
Caird said in a separate action to protest against the government's policy on public sector employment, members of the CSPU would begin a campaign of rolling stopages on Friday.
"The action is taken against more central concerns that we have about government policy and will start with a two hour stoppage in Melbourne tomorrow," Caird said.
